programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Luis se ha quedado sin trabajo, por lo que buscará una nueva actividad para invitar a Silvia a salir. Por otro lado, Luismi ha llegado solo al edificio.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Pedro invita a salir a Cris, la mejor amiga de Silvia, y organiza una cita doble con Luis y Silvita. La alcaldía instala una cámara de fotomultas y los flashazos apuntan directo al edificio.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Después de un tiempo de salir juntos, Luis le pregunta a Silvia qué son y quiere que se decida de una vez. La alcaldía instala lámparas de led en el alumbrado público y la no deja dormir a los vecinos.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Luis invita a Silvia a ver una película a su casa, pero Pedro interrumpirá su romántico momento, pues quiere recuperar su tele. Por otra parte, Arturo jugará póker con Germán, Jorjais y Benito.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Luis y Pedro hacen una apuesta para saber si se dice pantuflas o pantunflas y le preguntarán a todos los vecinos. Lorena sospecha que Benito está molesto por su nuevo galán.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Germán descubre que en el edificio hay una plaga de cucarachas, por lo que Magdalena le ordena que haga una inspección en su departamento.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Alguien grafiteó la fachada del edificio. Para retirarlo, Germán cambia el número de la entrada. ¿Recibirá Luis el paquete que espera? ¿Acudirán a pintar el departamento de Lorena?

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Magdalena descubre que las personas de tercera edad recibirán tarjetas de ayuda. La familia López Pérez intenta obtener el beneficio. A Luis le molesta que Benito tenga un auto nuevo.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Comienza una guerra tras la pelea entre Silvia y Luis, sin embargo él le pide matrimonio. Lorena le pide a Germán que arregle una mesa.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Luis y Silvia anuncian su boda y los vecinos los convencerán para que se casen en el edificio y ayudarán a los preparativos.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Los vecinos se quejan de los ruidos que vienen del departamento de Luis y Silvita, Germán intenta reparar la tubería de Lorena y los López Pérez sufren de comezón.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Frankie regresa a vivir al edificio, con Lorena y con Benito, pero con la condición de que encuentre trabajo. Pero, en vez de eso, escribirá una nueva película.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Vanesa vuelve al edificio para visitar a los Vecinos y ponerse al corriente. Benito invita a su novia a "ver pelis" en el departamento, al enterarse de que sus papás saldrán.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Como Luis le ha preparado el desayuno, Silvita se encargará de prepararle a su esposo un platillo espectacular.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: In a neighborhood in Mexico City, the neighbors have problems and silly misadventures with one another.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Germán le entrega a Vanessa cosas que le dejó don Roque, por lo que ambos lo recuerdan y homenajean. Lorena aprecia a Soledad, la nueva amiga de Benito.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Como el tamalero no deja dormir a Luis, este le pedirá que le baje a su bocina. Ve cuántos enemigos se echará encima, por dejar sin trabajo al tamalero.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: Por pedirle a Morris que ponga en su tarea que son paramédicos, Rocko y Ale deben ir a la escuela a dar un curso de primeros auxilios. Llegan nuevos vecinos al departamento 301.

programme.title: Sortilegio
programme.desc: Alejandro returns home after a terrible accident to discover that he is married to Maria Jose, a poor, innocent girl who was deceived by Alejandro's brother Bruno. Bruno used Alejandro's name to marry Maria Jose, soon after he sent to kill his brother in hopes that Maria Jose would inherit Alejandro's fortune. But when Maria Jose arrives at the mansion she realizes that Bruno lied to her and used her. She is also scared when Alejandro is found alive and returns home. Doctors tell Alejandro that he suffers from memory loss but he is convinced he never met Maria Jose before and goes in search of the truth, but during this time and Maria Jose actually fall in love, while Bruno and Maura (Alejandro's ex-girlfriend) plot to break them up. Meanwhile, the brothers' mother Victoria has fallen in love with Fernando--Alejandro's best friend, so closer to his age than hers.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Leon asks Alicia about Diego's whereabouts; Madariaga arrives with Diego and says that I accompany him to do an errand. Jose Lujan shows Alma an email where Teo is declared to Roberta. Mia tells Alma that Franco will go to New York with Valeria. Madariaga receives a summons from the commission because Leon denounced him.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Six teenagers with different lives and personalities attend a prominent private school with only one thing in common: their vocation and passion for music.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Six teenagers with different lives and personalities attend a prominent private school with only one thing in common: their vocation and passion for music.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Leon questions Paula because he has not cashed the check and forbids him to see Diego again. Franco tells Mia that Valeria will not be able to go to the trip. Mia sends a message to Giovanni asking if he wants to be her boyfriend. Galia asks Pascual for the job of English teacher.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Six teenagers with different lives and personalities attend a prominent private school with only one thing in common: their vocation and passion for music.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Madariaga is warned that everything points against him. Moncho tells Alma that Marina died trying to escape with another member of the group. Mia records Joaquin selling the pills to Vico. The father of Roberta realizes that this one escaped.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Six teenagers with different lives and personalities attend a prominent private school with only one thing in common: their vocation and passion for music.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Alma advises Franco to tell Mia the truth about Marina. Giovanni warns Miguel to stop bothering Mia because he is her official boyfriend; Vico confirms it to Miguel. Leon removes the complaint found from Madariaga. Madariaga receives the proposal to take the position of director.

programme.title: Rebelde
programme.desc: Pascual announces to the students that Joaquin will not be expelled. Teo destroys Jose Lujan's computer. Lupita returns to Nico the gifts she gave him and sees Mia's diary. Franco denies Mia the relationship between Marina and the rock band. Lupita tells Mia that her diary is in Miguel's room. Madariaga notifies Pascual that he did not accept the position of director. Leon gives Paula a jewel; Diego gives Paula a ring.

programme.title: Amores verdaderos

programme.title: Amores verdaderos
programme.desc: Victoria reclama a Arriaga besar a Joselyn. Doris y Joselyn quieren organizar el cumpleaños de Victoria. Candelaria le promete a Cristina visitarla. Nelson hace una fiesta sorpresa para Victoria.

programme.title: Amores verdaderos
programme.desc: Anibal sufre por creer q Candelaria murió. Guzmán se sincera con Niki. Paula le reclama a Aníbal por ser un mal padre. Salcero se encuentra con Beatriz en el baile. Kendra quiere ayudar a Nelson a comprar el regalo para Victoria.

programme.title: Amores verdaderos
programme.desc: Lily mejora y le pide perdón a Arriaga y a Victoria. Stefano y Jean Marie se van a casar y Odette apoya a su hijo. Lily le desea felicidad a Guzmán y Nikki y terminan amigos. Aníbal hace negocios cochinos.

programme.title: Amores verdaderos

programme.title: Sasquatch Unearthed: Mountain State Monsters
programme.desc: Beth Duncan is experiencing something truly bizarre on her property outside Wineberry, West Virginia. Here, amongst the hills and hollers of the mountain state, a mystery is unfolding that stretches the limits of what we know about Bigfoot. Accompanying her various encounters with a family group of Sasquatch, are mysterious lights, ghostly apparitions, and tales of growling, formless phantoms. Ron Lanham and Joe Perdue bring their years of paranormal research to the table in an effort to help Beth sort out just what is taking place. Meanwhile, various researchers from around West Virginia weigh in on the possibility that there is much more to the Bigfoot phenomenon than just an unknown ape in the woods.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: From The New York Times: Fleeing city life and embracing a pastoral existence: It's not just for Instagrammable fantasies anymore. Well, actually, it still is, and this British series from 2010 serves as a good reminder that small-scale farming is a tremendous undertaking. Get ready to learn about pig mange, for example, and the need to follow local building ordinances lest your would-be alpaca farm violate the law. Still, this show is mostly Monty Don giving gentle guidance and nonjudgmental suggestions. And advice like "get to know your neighbors" and "educate yourself about relevant issues" is as valuable in the concrete jungle as it is on a fledgling flower farm.

programme.title: My Dream Farm

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In this series Monty Don travels around the country helping amateurs to create the garden of their dreams. This week he comes to the rescue of two sets of gardeners in desperate need of feel-good spaces. In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Their current garden is a building site, but armed with advice from Monty they attack the challenge head on. With so many requirements from one small space, it feels their garden might burst at the seams. A trip to the Chelsea Flower Show soon has them focused on what's really important, but do they have enough energy left to get the work done? Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life, but her 'concrete driveway' of a garden has brought her plans to an abrupt halt; she has no idea how to plant in or on it! A visit to an inspirational pottery puts her back on track, but with so many choices can Valerie decide on the right ones?

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: The program explores the blossoming of Greek art, philosophy and culture in the 5th century B.C. and contrasts it with its political discord, social injustice and endless war.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles traces Alexander the Great's battle-scarred route through Turkey, Syria and Lebanon to Egypt and ultimately to the western Punjab, Pakistan, where he discovers fascinating traces of a city where Greek west and Buddhist east were united in an intriguing new way. It was Alexander's successors, the Hellenistic Kings, who had to make sense of the legacy of this legendary adventurer. By knuckling down to the hard graft of politics, taxation and public works, they created something far more enduring than a mere legend - they built a civilization.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: How did an insignificant cluster of Latin hill villages on the edge of the civilised world become the greatest empire the world has known? Archaeologist and historian Richard Miles examines the phenomenon of the Roman Republic, from its fratricidal mythical beginnings, with the legend of Romulus and Remus, to the all too real violence of its end, dragged to destruction by war lords like Pompey the Great and Julius Caesar.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.sub-title: City of Man, City of God
programme.desc: In the last of the series, Richard Miles examines the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. At the height of its power, the Roman Empire extended the benefits of its civilization to a 60 million citizens and subjects in a swathe of territory that extended from Hadrian's Wall to the banks of the Euphrates. But the material benefits of the 'good order' delivered by Roman rule provided its citizens and subjects with the security to ask profound questions about the meaning of life, questions that the pragmatic, polytheistic Roman belief system was ill-equipped to answer.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella returns to his cherished boyhood stomping grounds along Michigan‚Äôs Muskegon River. He'll paddle his canoe through the marsh to camp and bow fish for sucker, bowfin, and gar. With the rich bounty of overlooked aquatic foods that can be found in this freshwater paradise, he'll demonstrate how beat the heat by salt curing fish and later he'll prepare a camp meal of fried gar.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and friend Cody Lujan head to Northeastern New Mexico to hunt pronghorn antelope, the fastest big game animal in the United States. In the wide open desert plains, Steve will have to work hard to stalk within range of a mature buck. The payoff will be antelope loin topped with local New Mexico chiles.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this cooking special, Steven Rinella shows his fans some of his favorite preparations for big, bone-in cuts of red meat. Interspersed with highlights from his recent caribou, buffalo, and mule deer hunts, the show features recipes that utilize some of the most underappreciated parts of big game animals. This episode is an attractive and delicious tribute to Steve‚Äôs gun-to-table ethic.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella returns to his favorite hunting grounds of Sonora, Mexico to hunt for a Coues deer buck during the peak rutting season. Steve sets up camp and spends days glassing mountains and canyons for these elusive, wary desert whitetails. Meanwhile, his hunting partner, Remi Warren, attempts the difficult task of stalking one with a bow. To cap off the hunt, Steve cooks a batch of venison ribs braised in a Dutch oven buried beneath hot coals.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode, Steven Rinella joins forces with fellow hunter and wild game chef Hank Shaw in the hills of Central California to go after Columbia blacktail deer, wild pigs, and a handful of small game species that are in season. The end result is a culinary smorgasbord of epic proportions.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve ventures out to his hunting and fishing shack on a remote coastline of southeast Alaska‚Äôs Prince of Wales Island. While hunting bears from a skiff and a canoe, Steve gathers a variety of prime seafood and makes a discovery about his own motivations as a bear hunter.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella breaks down an entire boar and shares some of his favorite recipes in this Cooking Special. Matt Weingarter helps steve make head cheese, pork skin cracklins, smoked pork butt, and a tied-roast boned-out ham. Each dish requires thoughtful butchering, processing, and cooking to execute to perfection.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan float a remote river on a bull moose hunt in the wilderness of British Columbia. Here, they'll face one of the most dangerous moments in Steve‚Äôs life as a hunter. But they'll also enjoy one the best wild game meals they've ever tasted.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve must deal with bad weather and fierce competition during a late-season central Montana elk hunt. With some tips from a friend, Steve encounters plenty of elk on this public land hunt. But he'll have to hike hard in steep country and deep snow to get to the elk and away from other hunters.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan, a British Columbia guide, hike into the steep backcountry of northern British Columbia in search of grizzlies and black bears. Among the beutiful alpine vista, this adventure includes some intense and up-close bear action ‚Äì almost too close.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan, a British Columbia guide, hike into the steep backcountry of northern British Columbia in search of grizzlies and black bears. Among the beutiful alpine vista, this adventure includes some intense and up-close bear action ‚Äì almost too close.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his buddy Doug Duren give comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen their first taste of Midwest deer hunting culture by sitting in freezing ground blinds on opening day in Wisconsin. It just wouldn't be a trip to the Duren Family Farm without a little trapping and duck hunting thrown in, rounding out the larder for a big wild game feast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his buddy Doug Duren give comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen their first taste of Midwest deer hunting culture by sitting in freezing ground blinds on opening day in Wisconsin. It just wouldn't be a trip to the Duren Family Farm without a little trapping and duck hunting thrown in, rounding out the larder for a big wild game feast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his friend and wild turkey specialist, Robert Abernathy, head to southern Florida to hunt Osceola gobblers. Steve hopes to finish off his Royal Turkey Slam, achieved by bagging all five subspecies of the American wild turkey‚Äîa quest that‚Äôs been a decade in the making. These two turkey hunting fanatics celebrate with a delicious meal of grilled and stuff wild wild turkey breast.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella is invited by the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation for a special opportunity to hunt elk during the rut in the mountainous coal country of southeastern Kentucky, a place where his hero Daniel Boone once roamed. This is Steve‚Äôs first eastern elk hunt, and he quickly realizes that the rules of the game here are different. If he manages to track one down, he‚Äôll prepare what was supposedly Boone‚Äôs favorite meal: elk liver.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Join Steve on this Cooking Special as he dives into the best of Alaskan seafood, featuring shrimp, crab, fish, and clams. Learn how to make easy, delicious seafood recipes that showcase the fresh flavors of the sea. Whether you're a seasoned cook or a beginner, Steve's simple steps will help you prepare mouthwatering dishes that capture the essence of Alaskan waters.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve's annual quest for a giant mule deer buck continues this year in southwest Colorado. Here, Steve fills us in on his favorite critter, the mule deer. As he hunts will share his vast knowledge about these special western game animals including how to hunt, butcher, and most importantly how cook them-if he can put his tag on one.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella scratches his spring turkey itch this year as he visits Southeast Wisconsin to call in some big eastern Toms with his buddy Jerod Fink. The guys also plan to do some bow fishing after dark so they can enjoy a real Midwest turkey and fish fry.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, but is often overlooked by wild game cooks at home. Following a series of successful hunts across North America this past fall, Steve demonstrates how to cook a variety of breakfast classics using wild game ingredients‚Äîincluding black bear bacon, which Steve has never tried before.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: After four years of waiting, Steven Rinella draws a coveted, limited-entry public land bull elk tag for New Mexico‚Äôs Gila National Forest. Steve heads into the backcountry on a solo backpack hunt where his biggest challenge is the vast expanse of hills covered in thick timber. This demanding hunt requires lots of glassing and even more hiking. Here, even just one missed opportunity could result in an empty freezer.
